lom:description.lom:string: "The PipeLINK program seeks to attract and retain women and girls into careers in computer science. Aimed at girls and women from the high school through the Ph.D. level, the program provides activities to aid participants at each level, and role models and mentors from the levels above, as well as an introduction to a wide variety of computer science topics. This paper describes PipeLINK activities that were carried out during the academic year 1994-95 and the summer of 1995, including an evaluation of their effectiveness."

lom:keyword.lom:string: attract women, retain women, retention, underrepresentation, pipeline, girls, computer science, role models, mentors, mentoring, summer program, research, computing, female role models, chat groups, program evaluation, electronic mentoring network, email, internet access, C++, databases, questionnaires, teacher's workshop

lom:title.lom:string: PipeLINK: Connecting women and girls in the computer science pipeline
